name: Laserland
overview: Laserland is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up for the Commodore 64. It was developed and published by Outlaw-Emix Software using the Shoot 'em Up Construction Kit in 1989. The game is a bit different from most early SEUCK games in that it features a diaganol/pseudo-isometric playing field. The game has both single player and two player co-op.
